title:
Analysis of natural cardinal ranking vectors for pairwise comparisons
  and the universal efficiency of the Perron geometric mean
authors: S. Furtado and C. R. Johnson
abstract:
In models using pair-wise (ratio) comparisons among alternatives, a cardinal
ranking vector should be deduced from a reciprocal matrix. The right Perron
eigenvector (RP) was traditionally used, though several other options have
emerged. We consider some alternatives, mostly new, namely the entry-wise
reciprocal of the left Perron vector (LP), the left singular vector (LS), the
entry-wise reciprocal of the right singular vector (RS), the arithmetic and
geometric means of RP and LP (AP and GP), and of LS and RS (AS and GS). (The
ranking vector AS was proposed by Gass and Rapcs\'ak (2004)). All 8 of these
vectors produce the natural vector in the consistent case. We compare them
empirically, in terms of efficiency, for random matrices, as a function of the
number of alternatives. It turns out that the vector GP is universily
efficient, and this fact is proven. The vector GS performs better that the
remaining 6 vectors. We show that, for reciprocal matrices obtained from
consistent matrices by modifying one column and the corresponding row, all 8
vectors are efficient. Moreover, the cone generated by the columns is
efficient.
